N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 332.3 - Psychologist's decision regarding arbitration

State Regulations
(a) Upon receipt of such notice of objection
(form A-1), the psychologist may request arbitration by notifying the chair in
accordance with the following: (1)
if only
arbitration issues are raised, the request for arbitration shall be made within
60 days after receipt of the notice of objection (A-1); (2)
if there are issues requiring
adjudication by a Workers' Compensation Law judge in addition to arbitration
issues, the request for arbitration shall be made within 60 days of the filing
of the decision in favor of the psychologist; and
(3)
failure to make timely request for
arbitration shall be deemed a waiver of the right to arbitration. If the psychologist wishes to arbitrate the bill, he or she
shall complete and sign the request for arbitration and forward it to the

Psychology Practice Committee, together with a check to the order of the Chair, Workers' Compensation Board, in the sum of $5 as a minimum expense fee. Notwithstanding any provision in this section to the contrary, upon application
of the psychologist, the chair may for good cause shown excuse the psychologist
for delay in filing the request for arbitration, and schedule the disputed bill
for arbitration. (b) Failure of the psychologist to render a
bill to the employer or carrier within 90 days from the last day of the month
in which services were rendered shall be deemed to be a waiver of the right to
arbitrate the bill. Notwithstanding any provision in this section to the
contrary, upon application of the psychologist, the chair may for good cause
shown excuse the psychologist for the delay in submitting such bill to the
carrier, and schedule the disputed bill for arbitration. Notes
